summary: This is an email chain from June 2011 involving Jeffrey Epstein discussing potential travel plans to the Caribbean with at least one other individual. The email includes a confidentiality notice claiming attorney-client privilege and stating the communication is the property of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Email sender and subject of communication
persons.context: The primary sender and recipient of emails, discussing travel plans and inviting others to join. The confidentiality footer claims the communication is his property.

events.title: Proposed Caribbean trip
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein discusses a trip to the Caribbean, proposing travel on Friday and return early Sunday morning, and invites others to join.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was actively planning personal travel to the Caribbean in June 2011.
The email chain shows Epstein using the email address jeevacation@gmail.com.
The communication includes a repeated confidentiality notice claiming attorney-client privilege and stating it is the property of Jeffrey Epstein.
At least one other individual (with a redacted or obscured email address) is involved in the travel planning conversation.
The document is marked as confidential by the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
